This E-ATX workstation motherboard is designed to provide a reliable foundation for professional creative workloads such as video editing and 3D rendering. The Pro WS WRX80E-Sage SE fully utilizes the large PCIe 4.0 data bandwidth to deliver high performance with compatible devices, such as the eight memory slots, which support up to 2048GB of DDR4-3200 octa-channel ECC buffered memory for automatic data error correction. The dual 10G Ethernet ports provide high-speed data transfers with compatible networks and devices. Windows 10 64-bit is required to take advantage of all the motherboard's features. The included ASUS Hyper M.2 x16 Gen 4 card allows you to add up to four additional M.2 PCIe 4.0 SSDs to your system and create a bootable RAID array. Asus ROG STRIX B650-A GAMING WIFI DDR5 AM5 ATX Motherboard

The ASUS ROG STRIX B650-A GAMING WIFI AM5 ATX Motherboard is designed for gamers seeking solid connection and better performance, allowing experienced builders to exploit the power of AMD's Ryzen 8000 & 7000 CPUs and gaming-focused components. With an AMD AM5 socket, you may easily install a wide choice of AMD Ryzen CPUs from the 7000 Series family. Four DDR5 DIMM slots provide you with the speed and performance you need for gaming, as well as editing and recreating your favorite in-game moments. You may install an array of storage devices using the four SATA III and three M.2 ports, producing a vast library for your games, video assets, and more. Add one PCIe 4.0 x16, one PCIe 4.0 x16 (in x4 mode), and two PCIe 4.0 x1 slots for graphics and utility cards. With USB 2.0, 3.2 Gen 1, Gen 2, and Gen 2x2 connectivity, you may plug in your favorite peripherals such as keyboards, mice, audio interfaces, and more. Bluetooth 5.2 is available for wireless devices such as headphones and controllers. Use the included 2.5 Gigabit Ethernet connector for wired connections or the Wi-Fi 6E (802.11ax) signal for a rapid and reliable cable-free experience.

Power Design

The Asus ROG STRIX B650-A GAMING WIFI Motherboard Sporting 12+2 power stages and 8+4 pin ProCool power connectors, the ROG STRIX can deliver reliable and stable performance for your components. Hi-end chokes and capacitors are engineered to resist extreme temperatures while the eight-layer PCB quickly dissipates heat around voltage regulators and offers greater overclocking headroom.

Cooling Capabilities

The Asus ROG STRIX B650-A GAMING WIFI Motherboard Covering the power solution are two thick heat sinks with strategic airflow channels for increased heat dissipation while powering high-performance Ryzen 7000 Series processors. High-quality thermal pads are utilized between power stages and heat sinks, helping to improve heat transfer and reduce VRM operating temperatures. M.2 heat sinks cover every slot to help keep onboard NVME SSDs at optimal temperatures for consistent performance and reliability. CPU and chassis headers also allow you to leverage various liquid and air-cooling components for optimal performance.

Next-Gen M.2 Support

The Asus ROG STRIX B650-A GAMING WIFI Motherboard with Experience lightning-fast performance with PCIe 5.0 and 4.0 slots for M.2 storage drives, enhancing application loading and general system performance. Each of the M.2 SSD slots is equipped with integrated heat sinks to help support and keep your storage drives cool.

USB Ports

This Asus ROG STRIX B650-A GAMING WIFI Motherboard An array of back panel USB ports allows you to plug in your most useful and essential devices with ease. USB-A 2.0 ports offer support for keyboards and mice while the USB-A and USB-C 3.2 Gen 2 ports provide you with 10 Gb/s data transfer speeds, suitable for audio interfaces and external storage drives. For even greater performance, a USB-C 3.2 Gen 2x2 port offers up to 20 Gb/s speeds.

Networking

The Asus ROG STRIX B650-A GAMING WIFI Motherboard has Onboard Wi-Fi 6E technology that takes advantage of the 6 GHz bands to provide up to seven 160 MHz channels for ultrafast throughput and better performance in dense wireless environments. Low-latency gaming, speedy file transfers, and high-resolution video streaming are among the many perks of onboard Intel 2.5 Gigabit Ethernet.

Audio

ROG SupremeFX is a unique blend of hardware and software technologies that provide superior audio. The ROG STRIX B650-A GAMING WIFI implementation features the ALC4080 codec for high-resolution playback up to 32-bit/384 kHz across all channels. Front-panel output is streamed through the integrated Savitech amplifier that can drive high-fidelity acoustics to a wide variety of speakers and headsets.

DIY-Designed

ASUS developed the ROG STRIX B650-A GAMING WIFI to include a wide variety of integrated improvements designed to ease the installation process of the motherboard as well as components. PCIe Slot Q-Release and M.2 Q-Latch enable easy installation and removal of GPUs and solid-state drives. Clear CMOS internal jumper and BIOS Flashback button offer easy diagnosis and upgrading of the hardware's firmware.

Aura Sync

The Asus ROG STRIX B650-A GAMING WIFI motherboards feature ASUS Aura technology, enabling full lighting control and a variety of presets for both onboard RGB LEDs and third-party accessories. Effects can be easily synced across compatible ROG graphics cards, monitors, keyboards, and mice to give your setup a unified look.

full_description:
Asus PRIME B450M-K DDR4 AMD AM4 Socket Motherboard

Rounding off our ASUS B450 launch day overviews is the microATX alternative to the ASUS Prime B450-Plus motherboard, the Prime B450M-K. This smaller form factor motherboard uses a lot of the same components as the ATX sized Prime B450-Plus RealtekÃ¢â¬â¢s ALC887-VD2 audio codec and RTL8111H Gigabit networking chip, as well as featuring the same level of memory compatibility with DDR4 being supported out of the box. The style and design run in symmetry with the ATX sized version (Prime B450-Plus) and has a clean and clutter free black PCB, with a grey triangle shaped pattern. The B450M-K omits any integrated RGB backlighting on-board, instead, users can make use of lighting emanating from the PCIe slot and audio trace paths which gives the impression the audio area of the PCB has separation. Due to the microATX form factor, the Prime B450M-K features a single full-length PCIe 3.0 x16 slot with a further two PCIe 2.0 x1 slots. Memory wise, the board has support for DDR4-3200 with a total capacity of up to 32 GB of system memory over the two provided slots. The Prime B450M-K represents one of the most basic B450 motherboards at launch, but this is reflected in the pricing ASUS gone with for this Prime branded board. To provide power from the PSU to the motherboard, a 24-pin ATX input can be found on the right-hand side of the board, with an 8-pin ATX 12 V power input dedicated for providing power to the CPU. Aside from the ROG Strix branded B450 pairing, the Prime B450M-K from the images looks as though it has a 6-phase Digi+ power delivery; albeit without any heatsink to help with dissipating heat from the MOSFETs and other phase componentry. A total of four SATA 6 Gbps ports supporting RAID 0, 1 and 10 arrays is present. All four SATA 6 Gbps ports sit around the edge at the bottom right-hand corner of the board and feature straight angled connectors. In addition to these, is a single PCIe 3.0 x4 and SATA compatible M.2 slot which supports drives up to a sizing of M.2 2280 (22 x 80 mm). The sizing and budget-friendly nature of the Prime B450M-K allows for only two 4-pin fan headers throughout the board, with one dedicated to the CPU fan and the other to a single case fan; fan splitters could be used to increase the number of support fans, although it would depend on the voltage of the headers which is currently unknown. In addition to the six USB Type-A ports on the rear and additional four USB 2.0 ports can be had from using the internal headers. On the rear panel, there are a total of two USB 10 Gbps Type-A ports as well as a further four USB 3.1 5 Gbps Type-A ports. Powering the three 3.5mm audio jacks is the Realtek ALC887-VD2 audio codec and the single LAN port is controlled by the Realtek RTL8111H Gigabit networking chip. Unlike every other ASUS B450 motherboard, the Prime B450M-K has a separate PS/2 port for both a keyboard and mouse, with a single DVI-D and VGA output provided to allow use with the AMD Ryzen APUs.

This Asus PRIME B450M-K DDR4 AMD AM4 Socket Motherboard comes with 03 years warranty.

ASUS TUF GAMING A620M-PLUS AMD AM5 Micro-ATX Motherboard

The ASUS TUF GAMING A620M-PLUS is a Micro-ATX motherboard designed for gaming. It supports the AMD Socket AM5 for AMD Ryzen 7000 Series Desktop Processors. The motherboard features the AMD A620 chipset and supports up to 128GB of DDR5 memory with speeds up to 6400MHz (OC). It has dual-channel memory architecture and supports AMD Extended Profiles for overclocking. The graphics capabilities include 2 x DisplayPort and 1 x HDMI ports, with support for high-resolution displays up to 8K at 60Hz and 4K at 60Hz respectively. The expansion slots consist of 1 x PCIe 4.0 x16 slot for the CPU and 2 x PCIe 3.0 x1 slots for additional expansion cards. For storage, it has 2 x M.2 slots (supporting PCIe 4.0 x4 mode) and 4 x SATA 6Gb/s ports. The ASUS TUF GAMING A620M-PLUS Motherboard also features 1 x Realtek 2.5Gb Ethernet, USB 3.2 Gen 1 and USB 2.0 ports, Realtek 7.1 Surround Sound High Definition Audio CODEC, and various internal I/O connectors for fans, power, storage, and USB. It comes with ASUS TUF PROTECTION features for enhanced durability, ASUS Q-Design for easy installation and maintenance, and ASUS Thermal Solution for efficient cooling. The ASUS TUF GAMING A620M-PLUS Motherboard supports ASUS-exclusive software such as Armoury Crate and AI Suite 3 for system optimization and control. It is compatible with Windows 11 and Windows 10 64-bit operating systems.
